meanings.definition: Proteins that contain carbohydrates attached to them.
meanings.sent1: The glycoproteins on the cell surface help with communication between cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying glycoproteins to understand their role in the immune system.
meanings.sent3: The glycoproteins at the party were the sweetest guests, always bringing sugar with them.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like glycoproteins, sweet and essential for a healthy interaction.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model to explain how glycoproteins work in the body, making it easier to remember.

meanings.definition: Molecules consisting of a protein and a carbohydrate group.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how glycoproteins are formed in the body.
meanings.sent2: Food labels list the glycoproteins present in the product.
meanings.sent3: The glycoproteins in the science experiment were like a delicious protein-carbohydrate sandwich.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cells, glycoproteins are the ultimate power couple, combining strength and sweetness.
meanings.sent5: The student created a colorful diagram to illustrate the structure of glycoproteins for the class.
